t: Psalm 109
Help Me, O Lord My God
To the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.
Be*pn not silent, O God of my praise!
For*ln wicked and deceitful mouths are opened against me, speaking*ld against me with lying tongues.
They*ln encircle me with words of hate, and*ld attack me without cause.
In*ln return for my love they accuse me, but*ld I give myself to prayer.
So*ln they reward me evil for good, and*ld hatred for my love.
Appoint*pn a wicked man against him; let*ld an accuser stand at his right hand.
When*ln he is tried, let him come forth guilty; let*ld his prayer be counted as sin!
May*ln his days be few; may*ld another take his office!
May*ln his children be fatherless and*ld his wife a widow!
May*ln his children wander about and beg, seeking*ld food far from the ruins they inhabit!
May*ln the creditor seize all that he has; may*ld strangers plunder the fruits of his toil!
Let*ln there be none to extend kindness to him, nor*ld any to pity his fatherless children!
May*ln his posterity be cut off; may*ld his name be blotted out in the second generation!
May*ln the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the Lord,*s and*ld let not the sin of his mother be blotted out!
Let*ln them be before the Lord*s continually, that*ld he may cut off the memory of them from the earth!
For*pn he did not remember to show kindness, but*ld pursued the poor and needy and*ld the brokenhearted, to put them to death.
He*ln loved to curse; let curses come upon him! He*ld did not delight in blessing; may it be far from him!
He*ln clothed himself with cursing as his coat; may*ld it soak into his body like water, like*ld oil into his bones!
May*ln it be like a garment that he wraps around him, like*ld a belt that he puts on every day!
May*ln this be the reward of my accusers from the Lord,*s of*ld those who speak evil against my life!
But*pn you, O God*s my Lord, deal*ld on my behalf for your nameâ€™s sake; because*ld your steadfast love is good, deliver me!
For*ln I am poor and needy, and*ld my heart is stricken within me.
I*ln am gone like a shadow at evening; I*ld am shaken off like a locust.
My*ln knees are weak through fasting; my*ld body has become gaunt, with no fat.
I*ln am an object of scorn to my accusers; when*ld they see me, they wag their heads.
Help*pn me, O Lord*s my God! Save*ld me according to your steadfast love!
Let*ln them know that this is your hand; you,*ld O Lord,*s have done it!
Let*ln them curse, but you will bless! They*ld arise and are put to shame, but your servant will be glad!
May*ln my accusers be clothed with dishonor; may*ld they be wrapped in their own shame as in a cloak!
With*pn my mouth I will give great thanks to the Lord;*s I*ld will praise him in the midst of the throng.
For*ln he stands at the right hand of the needy one, to*ld save him from those who condemn his soul to death.
